de.eckhartarnold.client

Class StatusTag

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.eckhartarnold.client.StatusTag

  • public class StatusTag
extends java.lang.Object
    This class gives access to the status tag of the main html page. The status tag is identified by the id "statusTag".

    The purpose of the status tag is to inform the user about the ongoing loading and initialisation process before the widget tree is build up. It is suggested that its default value is the string "loading..." or something similar, e.g. '\

    Loading...<\/div\>'. Once initialisation is completed, the status tag should be removed via the remove() method.
    Author:
    eckhart

    • Method Detail

      • remove

        public static void remove()
        Removes the status tag from the DOM tree once and for all.

        Subsequent calls to getHTML() return the empty string "" and calls to setHTML() will be ignored.

      • getHTML

        public static java.lang.String getHTML()
        Returns the inner HTML of the status tag if it (still) exists or the empty string "" otherwise.
        Returns:
        the inner HTML code of the status tag

      • setHTML

        public static void setHTML(java.lang.String html)
        Sets the status tag if it (still) exists. Does nothing otherwise.
        Parameters:
        html - the html code for the status tag
